description:
I am proud to bring over 20+ years of solid experience as a Service and Repair Instrument Electrical Technician working at various locations around Australia, in the capacity of both a team member as well as a Team Leader. In particular, my experience has been at Major Hazards Facilities involving both Gas and Liquid Hydrocarbons. Some of the locations I have worked at include; Gorgon Gas Plant in Barrow Island, Blacktip Gas Plant in Wateye, Desalination Plant in Vic, Mobil Australia, San- tos in SW Queensland and Quenos in Victoria.
I pride myself in consistently providing excellent service and have a proven track record of being a highly effective team member, whatever the culture may be.
Throughout my employment I have strived for achieving results and exceeding expectations. I am commonly recognised for qualities such as adaptability and flexibility, being punctual as well as being an active, honest and trustworthy team member. Intrinsically, I am an enthusiastic, self-motivated in- dividual with a positive and ‘can do’ attitude. I thrive on challenges and always welcome technical is- sues requiring resolution.
Of particular note is my extensive maintenance experience in confined spaces (tanks, spheres, large drums) as well as outstanding safety proficiency (SH&E Excellence award and safety performance reviews).

Being an expert SAP user means I can contribute from day one. I used SAP “every day” to perform data entry, manage systems, troubleshoot issues, customise functionality and streamline business services to enhance business performance.

I possess excellent verbal and written English communication skills, which I applied to support business audiences from all around the world- especially in USA (and North America). I worked in diverse, dynamic and complex domains servicing users in FMCG, Retail, Healthcare, Corporate Services and IT. 

Working on my own and within specialist teams, my track record includes tier-1 global brand organisations such as: ITC Infotech, IBM, Johnson & Johnson, AmerisourceBergen, and Medtronic.

My 9+ years of extensive technology-based experience, includes working on System / Networks/Server / SAP Security and GRC Administration. Specifically, during past 7 years, has been working exclusively in SAP GRC and SAP R/3 Security/Architect (MM, PP, SD, FI).

Overall, as a strong administrator, I can be relied upon by managers and office teams to prepare, analyse, and process data in an accurate, effective and efficient manner. In saying this, I am ready to discuss employment opportunities and share my background to guarantee I am an ideal-fit. 

I am contactable any time via LinkedIn, E-mail and Mobile Phone. I welcome all invitations to connect.

description:
John is a self-motivated, results-orientated and experienced Sales Leader with an extensive and diverse background from Sales to Delivery.  He has an extensive understanding of the ANZ security market – from customers through to competitors – and uses this knowledge to develop successful sales strategies, particularly in competitive situations.  John also has a large network of contacts & relationships across the entire security industry and has the ability to leverage this network as required.  
John is team–oriented and prefers this approach, but with the understanding that each team member brings their own skills in order to achieve outcomes.  John has a proven ability to accept leadership from others or lead teams to achieve set objectives.  He is fully capable of demonstrating a long track record of successful engagements and positive customer feedback that would invite interest from any organisation focused on growth.
John is exceptionally capable in many roles, but has recently focused on Sales within the Cyber-Security industry.  John’s strengths are his pragmatic approach, confidence, diligence and determination to be successful.
jobDescription:
Representing AT&T Security products and services that are designed to help protect the resources our customers business depends on most and provides with the tools to prevent, detect and respond to threats.
As the technology required to run business evolves, so does the volume and complexity of threats against it. Our Network Security solutions utilise our unparalleled visibility, responsive analytics, security expertise and strategic alliances to help safeguard organisations from potential threats.

Representing AT&T @ IoT Association of Australia (IoTAA), WorkStream 5 – Cyber Security & Network Resilience
jobDescription2: Darktrace is one of the world’s fastest-growing cyber defense companies and a leader in Enterprise Immune System technology, a new category of cyber solutions based on pioneering Bayesian mathematics developed at the University of Cambridge. Darktrace addresses the challenge of insider threat and advanced cyber-attacks through its unique ability to detect previously unidentified threats in real time, as manifested in the emerging behaviours of the network, devices and individuals. Some of the world’s largest organisations rely on Darktrace’s adaptive, self-learning platform to spot anomalous activity within the enterprise, in sectors including energy and utilities, financial services, telecommunications, retail and transportation. Darktrace was founded by world-class machine learning specialists and operational government intelligence experts.

Summary
Colin Spence is a Senior Network Consultant with over 20 years of network and telecommunications experience in designing and consulting across Government, Finance, Utility and Resource industries.

Colin has a Bachelor of Applied Science (Computer Science and Mathematics) and has undertaken extensive industry based vendor training in Cisco, Nortel and Checkpoint. 

Colin has consulted and designed networks for many of CSC customer’s including GE Capital, Coles-Myer, BHP Billiton, AMP, Rio Tinto, Victorian Workcover Authority (VWA), Transport Accident Commission (TAC - Victoria), Shell, Alcoa, Water Corporation (WA), Main Roads (WA), Department of Lands & Administration (WA) and AXA.

Colin is an energetic and effective manager, leading a team of 21 consultants with a record of delivering complex, innovative projects to tight timelines and budgets. Colin, who reports directly to the Director of Managed Network Services in Australia, is accountable for team utilisation, resource assignment, performance and salary reviews as well as P&L for his team.

description:
My experience, in Australia and New Zealand has been the product and business development of new and emerging Telecommunications technologies.

So I have skills in Marketing, Sales, Technical and Business. 

I launched Trunked Mobile networks for Motorola, Television NZ and went on to Create and build businesses for Telecom NZ in Cellular mobile data and Vodafone in business Cellular 2.5G GPRS.

Following on from this I created and launched a Business Mobile email service with Optus.

After owning and working in my own small business providing IT network design and support, I joined an international Cellular SIM and SIM subscriber management company, G&D, where I did technical product and sales management.

Since joining CSC and now AT&T I have gained new experience delivering wireless network solutions on mine sites in Western Australia and Queensland.

Recently this has included designing LTE 4G network architectures for industrial users including for a mine site in Laos.

Mobile, Cellular and more recently WLAN technologies has been my industry sector. I have diversified my skills and experience to include Radio and IT components as today's user equipment and services combine both.

I have been pleased and excited to travel the globe both for fun and for work. I am glad to continue to be involved in the development and growth of communications technology as it expands to encompass and touch so many peoples life's and create so many benefits.

JPMorgan is an investment company that provides insight and world class investment solutions to meet the needs of investors. We are committed to bringing the global thought leadership and investment insights to the Australian market place.

I chose JPMorgan Asset Management as the opportunity to build a new business in Australia with such a committed and successful global brand is an exciting new challenge. 

Prior to JPMorgan I was heading up Vanguard's National Key Account team and on the Executive Distribution team,providing leadership, guidance and growing Vanguard's business to a market leading position in just over 5 years. 

Prior to Vanguard I held various roles with Goldman Sachs JBWere Asset Management including State Manager for WA, National Key Account Manager and Research & Platform Relationship Manager. Before GSJBW I was in management positions at the ANZ Group.

The specialties I bring to JPMorgan's leadership include, strategic guidance,  investment management insight,and connectivity to the Australian financial services and advice industry. 

Views expressed on LinkedIn are my own.

description:
I am a Procurement Manager working in Supplier Management for Boeing Aerostructures Australia (BAA). I am responsible for managing a team of buyers/procurement agents who primarily place supplier orders, manage supply chain health and lead all supplier based communications between BAA and the supply base. 
I started my working life in 2009 as a co-op student at GM Holden in the Facilities Engineering team. I worked on data analysis and a number of small projects relating to water usage throughout the engine manufacturing plant. In 2011 after graduating with an Automotive Engineering Degree from RMIT University Melbourne I went on to join the competitor. I spent a year working for the Ford Motor Company Australia as a Process Engineer, analysing vehicle design, conducting FMEA’s, process writing and assessing “ok to manufacture” status. 
I moved to BAA during 2011 in Industrial Engineering working on a project team focused on continuous improvement and lean warehousing initiatives.  In 2013 I moved into a Business Analyst role. In this role I focused mainly on the 787 program and was responsible for daily reporting on program status as well as supporting general reporting cadence and the construction of weekly/monthly reporting decks. In 2015 I moved into a Program Lead role responsible for leading program rate and leadtime studies, production readiness assessments, rate capability planning as well as being the site Risk Issue and Opportunity management focal and functional excellence lead. In 2016 I transitioned into the program manager role where my key focus was on planning, scheduling, budgeting, documenting and overseeing all aspects of the specific projects I was leading. 
I enjoy reading, clay target/riffle shooting and have an uncanny love for cars. Word of warning, I am an obsessive compulsive neat freak however in my line of work I have always been able to pass it off as the lean methodology of 5S!

I am currently leading Verizon's GRC and PCI practice for Australia and New Zealand.

I have over 20 years of industry experience and have developed a vast array of both technical and leadership skills. My career progression through development, analysis and design, team leadership and project management have enabled me to deliver strong solutions for clients. HPE help customers use technology to slash the time it takes to turn ideas into value. In turn, they transform industries, markets and lives. Some of our customers run traditional IT environments. Most are transitioning to a secure, cloud-enabled, mobile-friendly infrastructure. Many rely on a combination of both. Wherever they are in that journey, we provide the technology and solutions to help them succeed.

Hewlett Packard has been in the innovation business for more than 75 years. Our vast intellectual property portfolio and global research and development capabilities are part of an innovation roadmap designed to help organisations of all sizes – from global enterprises to local startups – transition from traditional technology platforms to the IT systems of the future.

We make IT environments more efficient, productive and secure, enabling fast, flexible responses to a rapidly changing competitive landscape. We deliver high-quality, high-value products, consulting, and support services in a single package. And with customised financing solutions and strategy, we can provide the right tech solutions for your unique business goals.

description:
With the extensive experience in network security design/implementation field, I am capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously and work under tight deadlines. Also, I have a good understanding of the project life cycle and complex business processes. 

My key specialties are as below:

→Security: Checkpoint / VSX
	          Juniper SRX / Netscreen 
	          Cisco ASA

                  Fortinet
                  VPN IPSec / SSL

→Routing & Switching: QoS, BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, MPLS

                                     Citrix Netscaler MPX / VPX

→WAN Optimisation: Riverbed Steelhead CX

VMware / SAN

Couple of my recent projects:

•	Designing and implementing Customer Service Hub (CSH) project to allow international traffic accessing Westpac internal zones via new IPSec Tunnels. This outstanding program includes BGP routes from the Zone0 traversing CheckPoint VSX’s, terminated on the Netscreen VSYS’s, then get authorised by Netscalers and finally passing through SRX LSYS’s and ending up DMZ servers. Received appreciation for meeting all the milestones and being 100% to the technical quality from the Westpac PM.

•	Upgraded F5 SSL certificates to SHA2 on the LTM and GTM monitors and VIPs (client & server sides) for all the Westpac internal and external URLs. This high profile project consisted of re-installing and troubleshooting client and server certificates and traffic handshake by the means of SSL Dump and TCP Dump on the production environment.

description:
Roee has extensive experience working as a counsellor, mental health social worker and personal development coach. Roee has worked across the public, private and corporate sectors in both the UK and Australia dealing with various clients and presenting issues.

QUALIFICATIONS

BA (psych), BSW, AMHSW, MAASW (adv Acc), Dip. Personal Performance Coaching 

* Qualified Personal Development Coach (Life Coach) 
* Qualified ACT therapist,
* Accredited Mental Health Social Worker,
* Medicare Provider (Australia) 

Roee uses positive psychology principles, tools & strategies to improve emotional health, psychological flexibility and ultimately the ability to see things from a greater perspective. 

SPECIALITIES

Personal Development Coaching, motivational interviewing, goal setting, beliefs/values work. 
Individual Counselling using ACT, CBT, Managing Stress/Anxiety/Depression and substance abuse
Working with people with disability, mental health and in the Aged Care sector.

CEO of Humantis Foundation
Community organisation whose goal is to take the stigma out of mental health.
The organisation will do this in a light-hearted, interactive way with a strong emphasis on using social media channels, to reach as many people as possible
To get involved https://fundrazr.com/campaigns/bs6A7/ab/042sL3

Main principles include:
1) Life doesn’t always go to plan (and this is okay)
2) Emotional pain and suffering are a normal part of life
3) ‘Negative’ thoughts are normal and have a functional role
4) All humans are, at times, hard on themselves
5) Psychological and emotional well-being will increase and decrease throughout a human’s life
6) Humans connecting with other humans (sharing their (normal) negative thoughts, difficulties and challenges) is therapeutic in itself.

description:
Data analytics is a cross-functional role that oversees the transmission of data within a business’ systems from entry to exit.

I liaise with researchers, marketing, user experience (UX) designers, and business stakeholders to ensure forms and applications are designed in a way that allows end users to capture data in an intuitive, accurate, and unambiguous fashion. I apply social research methods to ensure data are captured meaningfully, and data from different sources are captured in a consistent fashion to be as directly comparable as possible.

I work with database administrators to centralise information capture from multiple sources with appropriate data types, changelogs and version control, scalable architecture, and ensuring the business adheres to relevant regional privacy laws.

I work with business stakeholders and perform exploratory data analysis to identify areas of interest and value to the business and their customers, apply multidimensional statistical analysis to available datasets and stay up to date with developments in data visualisation techniques to present data in an engaging, meaningful, and actionable manner.

I maintain comprehensive documentation of data fields, database join logic and application dependencies to ensure future application changes or data migration projects do not negatively impact existing functionality.

I perform business analysis tasks such as process mapping and requirement gathering to ensure the business’ needs are well understood and implemented smoothly. When the subject matter is complex, I provide presentations and training seminars to ensure end users can take full advantage of the systems available to them.

description:
I have extensive banking & finance experience spanning over 25 years, which is predominantly made up of corporate business development as well as relationship management roles. With a current focus on Mergers, Acquisitions & Collaborations, I'm heavily involved with a diverse corporate business portfolio, specifically within the Design, Procure & Build industry.

I'm a specialist in supporting growth strategies for small & large businesses largely through strategic alliances, acquisitions or mergers. My skill set includes advisory functions such as Opex reduction, strategy formulation, joint ventures development & divestment strategy; from inception to execution. 

I'm familiar with the challenges businesses face in an ever-changing economic environment. But by working closely with business partners, I ensure a thorough understanding of a business’s key drivers & challenges, allowing for bespoke solutions & qualified advisory services to be presented in a clear and coherent manner. 

Well versed in the creation, development & implementation of various bespoke finance offerings for an array of clients, vendors & end-users, including tailoring finance solutions that enhance customer experience & improve the bottom line. 

Networking is also a strong focus and with Social Media playing a major part in connecting with people I am learning new techniques that enable me to be at the cutting edge of this field. 

My client base comprises Australian corporations, domestic and offshore funds and foreign corporations with operations in Australia and/or the Asian region

Specialties: M&A, JV's, Collaborations, Restructures, Acquisitions, & MBO's. Equipment Finance, Asset Finance, Leasing, CAPEX, Finance Lease, Operating Lease, Transport & Logistics Industry Solutions, Vendor Finance Programs, CRM, IT Finance options.

description:
One of my all-time favourite quotes is by Aristotle who said - “We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit”. This mindset was at the forefront of my mind when I started my client services career working for Dun & Bradstreet. At D&B I was chosen to service their worldwide internal offices. I relished being thrown into the deep end and quickly learnt that I loved the relationship building side of my role. I liked that I was a part of this niche market and I enjoyed the high pressure atmosphere that involved a combination of: complaint resolution, interpreting highly technical information, dealing with high value clients, training colleagues and being part of an "ideas generation" team who tested company software prior to implementation.

This experience led me to OnePath where I was introduced to the world of Insurance in a Case Management role as part of the Underwriting team. I liaised with advisers and clients in a high pressure environment and learned the fundamentals of how the end-to-end retail insurance process works. This was a valuable stepping stone to my current role - Business Development Officer. My BDO role is fast paced, dynamic, energetic and client focused – the areas where I thrive and perform at my best. Advisers come to me as a first point of escalation so I demonstrate high level problem solving skills and am able to think creatively outside of the box. My focus is to deliver a superior level of service and develop relationships with a defined panel of advisers and dealer groups.

I'm looking forward to meeting like minded professionals so feel free to connect if you think we have things in common.

description:
I am an experienced technical and program leader with a proven track record in software and system  architecture and design. The programs I am involved with use a variety of delivery strategies from traditional processes such a as functional requirements analysis, validation and development through to more modern agile methods where appropriate.

I have extensive extensive experience in all aspects of Geospatial application use and development and am a strong supporter and user of OGC Geospatial standards in my work. Recently this has extended to the  development of guidelines for Earth Observation data and implementing processing systems. I also have a good working knowledge of Remote Sensing science and related technology. In addition to these geospatial activities, I also participate in Industry development programs through related professional organisations. 

I have worked in a variety of industries and technology fields including software product development, engineering simulation, Defence geospatial solutions, high performance computing and as a technology lead for many research and development programs. I have been fortunate in my career to be able to take several concept and ideas for products and develop them to commercial quality applications and results.

In addition to my professional programming career I also enjoy developing analysis for strategic direction setting and assessing new and exciting technologies. 

My professional goals are to
- create relevant useful software applications.
- work in creative teams to meet new challenges.
- work closely with clients to achieve the best possible outcomes.
- engage in hi-tech science and technology projects.

I am supported in my work by my personal values: respect for others, getting the right outcomes for clients and partners and extending my knowledge and learning to new fields.

My current interests include android programming, natural language processing and Quantum Computing.
jobDescription:
As the Principal Technologist of Lockheed Martin Science, Technology, Engineering Leadership and Research Laboratory (STELaRLaB) my role is to develop and execute a portfolio of information based projects utilising Machine Learning, AI techniques, Geospatial Intelligence, C4ISR algorithm development system and autonomy research.  In addition to the to "information based" projects STELaRLab also undertakes research in various fields relevant to the Defence and National Security domains.

STELaRLab is Lockheed Martin's first Multi disciplinary and cross business area research and development  facility outside the United States.
jobDescription2:
My tasks at Lockheed Martin include 
1) Project Lead for the “Unlocking the LANDSAT Archive” Program sponsored by the Australian Space Research program. This program deals with the processing of Australia's archive of LANDSAT data    using HPC resources and making it available to the public as a calibrated dataset. This program is a joint program between Geoscience Australia, VPAC, CRC for Spatial information and ANU National Compute Infrastructure. This project is a Big Data project and we have developed a comprehensive approach to create a system for the future needs of Australia's earth observation community.
2) The design and development Geospatial and data indexing solutions for Defence.
3) Managing the Swift Lab (C4ISR) in Melbourne including dealing with diverse technology sets, ITAR issues and audits as well as customer demonstrations of integrated systems.
4) Managing R&D to support future work and development of staff
5) Supporting Business Development with technical proposal development

description:
Rubayet-E-Azim
Current Position: Research Engineer, STELaRLab, Lockheed Martin.

Rubayet-E-Azim Anee has previously worked as a Postdoctoral Researcher in MMARS Laboratory in Monash University, Clayton, Australia. She was a postgraduate intern in Lockheed Martin, Australia. She developed a Machine Learning technique for multi-dimensional classification problems. She has completed her PhD from MMARS group in Monash University and worked on Chipless RFID technology. Her PhD thesis is titled as 'Collision, Data Recovery and Localisation for Chipless RFID'. She completed her bachelor in Electrical and Electronic Engineering in 2009 from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET), Dhaka Bangladesh. She worked as a lecturer in Presidency University, Dhaka Bangladesh from 2009 to 2010.
jobDescription2:
Project 1: "Smart Shopping Trolley using Chipless RFID"
Customers can get excellent shopping experience is an RFID system based cloud computing interface is possible to installed. A chipless RFID enabled smart shopping trolley is proposed. The trolley is retrofitted with a chipless RFID tag reader. The items tagged with fully printable chipless RFID tag are scanned with the reader and recorded in the electronic list. The payment will be automated with cloud computing interfaced with the central database.

Project 2: "Wireless Power Pole Health Monitoring for Smart Grid"
A new smart sensing system for power pole health monitoring method is proposed. Instead of manual invasive and non-invasive pole heath monitoring methods, the proposed system provides a wireless monitoring of pole-health with the minimal of human intervention. Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) sensors are installed on the pole and mobile readers mounted on a vehicle or a garbage trucks receive the health monitoring information from the sensors. The collected data is send to the central database system (SCADA) via Wi-Fi (when possible) or cloud computing. This approach has the prospect of good management of power assets and equipment and shall save hundreds of dollars in the operation budget of utility companies.

description:
Highly motivated, customer focused and results driven Supply Chain and Retail professional, with 20 years experience.

I have held a number of Supply chain roles over last 10 years, including leadership/management roles in last 5 years, including leading a team of 30 supply chain professional, responsible for the end to end replenishment and supply of products for 770 stores nationally. This included Inventory management (purchasing/procurement), collaboration, partnering, working capital, stock flow, in store availability, Delivery In Full On Time, Service Level, Event management and execution.

Throughout the years I had the opportunity to manage the Supply Chains across a number of different, diverse and complex product portfolios (including Fresh, Food-shelf stable and Non Foods, in all different chambers and supply chain channels) with exposure to both domestic and international product groups, along with leading and managing large teams.

I am a strategic thinker with as instinctive ability to solve problems along with the ability to identify and address root cause, with this I can create different solutions and drive efficiency through simplification to improve performance or results.

I enjoy leading a team and have great collaboration skills and have a natural ability to build strong and sustainable relationships. I have proven track record of delivery High preforming teams and outstanding record of continuous and sustainable results improvements, across all Key Supply Chain performance indicators (driving down working capital, Cost reduction, Improvements in Service Levels, Delivery In Full On Time and instore availability).

I have a really strong work ethic, yet I believe my strongest asset is I am and authentic leader that is driven to motivate and inspire the team for continuous improvements.

description:
Mark Hunter is an experienced leader who is passionate about improving the value that businesses create for their customers. His goal is to help these businesses deliver outstanding results through a combination of customer focus, clear leadership, well structured thinking, first class market and business analytics and well presented, interesting and actionable insights.

Mark’s broad international management experience, gained in a career spanning financial services, engineering, marketing & strategy and compliance allow him to bring an extraordinary diverse range of skills to bear on difficult business problems. This experience is backed up by outstanding education results - Mark has won prestigious academic awards during his MBA (at Melbourne Business School / Instituto de Empressa) and his MEng (at Manchester University).

Mark’s ability to engage stakeholders at all levels in the organisation means that he can work effectively throughout the enterprise. He can quickly form strong working relationships, exercise outstanding influencing skills and remain focussed on delivering the key objectives in an environment of uncertainty and rapid change. These traits make him ideally suited to carrying out business transformation and change projects across reporting lines and business units.

Specialties: 

- Customer Research & Analytics
- Strategy
- Marketing

- Project Management
jobTitle: Head of Research, Insight and Innovation
jobDescription:
Accountable for leading the team charged with improving our customer experience (measured through NPS) across Consumer and Business banking, and supplying customer insight to all brands within the Westpac group. 

Collectively we were successful in moving Consumer banking NPS from last to first place in 1 year, and stretching Business banking NPS to a clear leadership position.

•	Research (qual and quant), covering both ad-hoc programs to understand key life moments and the other underlying drivers of customer needs in financial services, and “always on” programs such as brand and advertising tracking to provide insight into how we improve our performance
•	Customer Analytics, providing clear insight into how our customers interact with our business, and from this how we should develop our business to better meet their needs
•	Voice of Customer measurement (both external Market based NPS and internal touchpoint NPS programs), with all associated analysis and insight generation
•	Technology Transformation, ensuring that we have the right technology to generate data and insights on our customers and their interactions across our channels and warehouse / analytical environments
jobDescription2:
Key achievements in this role include:

•	Developing the 5 year business strategy for the Bank of Melbourne, crystallising the key areas of opportunity and differentiation. From this we identified the required branch presence, staff skills, capabilities & culture, products, and marketing necessary to deliver the 2020 business targets, along with detailed metrics and milestones that must be achieved along the way

•	Developing and launching the St George Banking Group cultural “Service Revolution”, with the aim of driving the level of customer service experienced by our customers to be our key strategic differentiator. This involved selecting a partner (the Ritz Carlton), engaging with stakeholders across the group, developing our cultural change roadmap and associated metrics, designing the first “in house” mobile app within the group and the delivery of a live “immersion roadshow” to ~5000 employees country-wide, with an average rating of 8.8 out of 10 from attendees

•	Building an analytical customer intelligence capability within the St George group. This took the form of customer intelligence “book” in our data warehouse, where all customer level information (internal and external) is joined and made available for analysis, overlaid with a state of the art visual analytics capability. This allows for real time customer analytics and the use of these analytics to drive customer-level decision making across strategy, finance, marketing, retail and business banking

description:
This position heads up the Human Resources function at the world class Epworth Hospital Richmond, which covers over 1850 staff and 420 acute beds. It is in the midst of a substantial growth phase with a number of major capital developments and acquisitions underway and will almost double in size over the coming years. This position operates autonomously, reporting into the off-site Corporate Executive Director of Human Resources. The Epworth Group is Victoria’s largest not-for-profit private hospital group, with over 1200 beds across numerous sites and over 4,500 staff. It provides acute medical and surgical services, sub-acute care, diagnostics and rehabilitation services for in excess of 120,000 patients annually. Epworth is committed to its position as a major provider of teaching and research activities into the future.

I have over fifteen years experience in Strategic Human Resources Management and Industrial Relations Workcover and safety, across dynamic, commercially focussed, public sector and not-for-profit organisations.

With First Class Honours in my Master of Business, I have a passion for improving organisational effectiveness through the alignment people management initiatives with strategy.

description:
Stig is currently the Director of People & Culture and former Head of Talent & Employee Experience at the Special Broadcasting Corporation (SBS).  He has had a varied career including four years as a professional singer and actor before making the move into the corporate world.  With his strong performance background the Learning & Development space was a natural entry point into the HR Industry. He started his HR career as a Learning & Development specialist before branching into the generalist Human Resource & Talent Management space.  After almost 7 years as a HR Manager at Australia’s largest media organisation, News Corporation, he joined Japanese international banking giant The Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ leading the banks Talent Management strategy across Australia and New Zealand. With over 15 years’ experience as a HR professional, Stig has established himself as an innovative and creative HR leader with a strong focus on Leadership, Talent Management, Diversity & Inclusion and Employee Experience. 

Stig joined SBS in 2013 and he is a passionate advocate for the SBS purpose to explore and celebrate diversity. He is currently leading the charge for transformational change at Australia’s coolest little public broadcaster.  In 2017 Stig on behalf of SBS partnered with Deloitte and the Human Rights Commission along with representatives from Westpac, QBE, and Qantas to support the development of a landmark study and report into the business case for customer diversity. Stig is an increasingly sought after conference speaker across the corporate and government sector on a range of topics including Diversity & Inclusion, Talent Management and Employee Experience.  He holds a Master’s Degree (with distinction) in Human Resource Management from the University of Western Sydney.

description:
I have over 35 years’ experience in the Real Estate industry. My first five years covered Residential Real Estate Lettings, Residential Real Estate & Property Management through to Commercial Property Management and Acquisitions as a fund manager.

From 1984 to 1996, I specialised in selling commercial office properties on Sydney’s North Shore. Post 1996, I moved into Office Leasing and built the business m² Office Leasing which controlled ‘Best of the Best’ office stock across the North Shore. I sold this business in 2011.

Forward to today, I am a real estate agent who adds value to the process of finding and introducing businesses to office space in Sydney. I win the right to act for clients who own office buildings, then manage the workload and introduce potential companies to Premium or A Grade office premises and negotiate leases. I was the 2015 winner of the REI NSW Commercial Sales / Leasing award.

In addition I bring new Real Estate work to Knight Frank where I share that work with other specialists within the KF network. In 2014/15 I shared fees with 15 others.

Also I travel each year to major global cities like San Francisco, New York, Singapore, Shanghai and Hong Kong where I am looking to extend my network to build a new channel of business.

My specialisations and interests across Commercial Real Estate and Office Leasing includes:

✔ Commercial Office Leasing 
✔ Office Leasing Specialist 
✔ Office Leasing Major Projects 
✔ Project Marketing
✔ Real Estate 
✔ Valuations and Auctioneer Specialisation
✔ Royal Institute of Chartered Surveyors
✔ Real Estate Institute of New South Wales ( NSW )

✔ I am based in Sydney 

✔ we work with the Commercial Office Leasing specialists, Knight Frank

If you have any questions or interest in Commercial Office Leasing in Sydney, please feel free to reach out.

See testimonials at https://kymbaldunne.com/testimonials/

Thanks,
Kymbal

Call: ✆ (0419) 992-068
Email: ✉ kymbal.dunne@au.knightfrank.com
jobDescription:
My role as Director - Client Solutions is to cultivate a better understanding of key clients’ property needs and to provide a consistently superior service across the Knight Frank business. These clients include established Ultra High Net Wealth Individuals with broad based investment property portfolios, Foreign Institutions, Corporations and Australian Property Institutions. The role allows me to assemble expert teams, to specifically meet the needs of those clients.
 
Knight Frank’s business in Australia is broad, encompassing Office, Industrial, Retail and Residential property. This means that I work across all different property functions. Whilst solutions to challenges in different locations can be similar in theory, the value of local knowledge, expertise and connections are all vital. My job is to understand the problem, determine the options, work with the client to agree on the best outcome and then with our specialist people, deliver the best solution. 

Having 22 offices across the country and a dynamic, well connected international network gives me reach. Our research team provides credibility. The Wealth Report and Global Cities Report, both produced annually are world class documents. Our local research is of a very high standard and we do many bespoke jobs as well. Our Asset Management Services business is a large part of the company’s revenue and provides day to day support and a very strong bond with our clients. Our transactions teams market properties and deliver tenants and buyers, as well as the opportunity to act for clients through investigations. Our Project Management and Building Consultancy team is first rate and we can take full control of building challenges and due diligence works.

This new role is huge, particularly across such an established International business. I can make quite a difference to clients by having a big picture view of the market and a small focused view of the solution to their challenge.

description:
After 10 years in the property industry, I pride myself on being the new breed of property professional, harnessing an energetic and forward thinking approach to both the strategic and transactional facets of property, built around an uncompromising ethos of transparency and desire to achieve the best possible win:win outcome in every transaction, whilst providing best in class service.

Beginning my property career in the residential market in 2006, I was privileged to hone my sales and customer service skills working under the 9 times awarded National Small Agency of the Year by the REIA, Sissons Estate Agents. Following this, I moved to McGrath Estate Agents, arguably the most successful real estate agency in the country, synonymous with unparalleled customer service and results. The training I received and experience I gained working with some the country’s most successful and experienced property professionals enabled me to develop a highly tuned skill set that I was able to transfer to the commercial property industry.

In 2013, I joined Knight Frank as commercial office leasing broker, quickly demonstrating my appreciation for the passion, pageantry and client and customer care required to successfully assist owners and occupiers solve and service their property requirements.

In 2015, after two very successful years in commercial leasing, brokering over 70 transactions, I was promoted to an Associate Director of the Knight Frank Office Leasing team, along with being recognised by the REINSW as a finalist for the Rising Star award and receiving the Budget Buster award for Knight Frank NSW. 

In 2016 I was selected to spend four weeks in the Knight Frank global head office in London. The Broadening Horizons program helped to further expand my view and perspective of, and my reach in, the global office market, enabling me to better service my clients and customers.

description:
Jin has joined Hunta Property as a Development Executive (AAPI) after extensive experience in the valuation industry at m3property and property agency at Knight Frank. He is responsible for land acquisitions directly interacting with proprietors across the market to service the development mandate of our clients.

At m3property, Jin was a Senior Valuer specialising in the Residential Development sector and achieved the status of Associate Member of the API as a Certified Practicing Valuer. Jin’s technical expertise has facilitated detailed valuation reports together with highest and best use assessments, feasibility studies and pre-purchase due diligence for mortgage, acquisition and advisory purposes for project types ranging from boutique residential unit/townhouse developments to high density mixed use residential apartment projects. 

Jin also gained valuable experience in the Asian Market Division at Knight Frank Australia. He was part of the successful establishment of a tailored property service for offshore Asian investors whilst also assisting in the management of capital transactions.

description:
I lead the Knight Frank Australia NSW Office Leasing business and am a member of the Knight Frank NSW Executive.  I have more than 20 years experience in the Commercial Property sector across the Australian office markets.

I specialise in the positioning and leasing of Prime Grade office assets ranging from full scale development and whole building refurbishment projects to major tenancy backfills.

Some career highlights have included:

• Leading the project team responsible for Grosvenor Place in Sydney for 17 years - the iconic Seidler-designed 85,000m² Premium Grade office tower managed by Dexus, Mirvac and Arcadia.  I secured over 54,000m² of new leasing results for Grosvenor Place over various campaigns including more than 20,000m² in the most recent campaign through to 2017.
• Over 17 years of continual re-appointment at 135 King Street, one of Sydney's most respected A Grade office towers, currently owned by Investa and Stockland - I have secured over 50,000m² of results in this asset since 2000.
• the repositioning of the entire 20 Bond Street (36,000m²) on behalf of Investa and Mirvac
• the repositioning of the entire 101 Miller Street (38,000m²) on behalf of Mirvac
• pre-commitment leasing project for Lend Lease at Darling Park Stage 2 (52,000m²) - upon completion, the tower was over 96% committed
• the repositioning of 45 Clarence Street (28,000m²) on behalf of Dexus

Career Awards have included:
• ‘Outstanding Achiever’ at 13 annual Australian Awards of Excellence, including those announced in 2017, as well as the last 2 Global Awards of Excellence at my previous employer
• ‘Transaction of the Year’ for Merrill Lynch in Governor Phillip Tower from Dexus (2005)
•  REI Award for Excellence for Project Leasing for 101 Miller Street (2008)
• 'Agent of the Year' from Investa (2015)

With a rich heritage and a reputation for excellence that dates back to 1855, Savills is a leading global real estate provider listed on the London Stock Exchange.

Savills is a company that leads rather than follows with more than 700 owned and associate offices throughout the UK, Europe, Americas, Asia Pacific, Africa and the Middle East. With more than 30,000 staff, we seek out people who possess that rare mix of entrepreneurial flair and rock solid integrity, and are focused on delivering clients with advice and expertise of the highest calibre.

A powerful combination of global connections and deep local knowledge provides Savills with an almost unparalleled ability to connect people and property. Savills extensive Asia Pacific network spans 50 offices throughout Australia, New Zealand, China, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Japan, Korea, Macao, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand and Vietnam.

Say it straight - We are honest and compassionate in our communication with each other and we are not afraid to admit our mistakes

The ultimate goal is to become an accredited employer of choice by 2020 and we are well on our way. description:
Stephen Ellis is Chief Executive Officer of Knight Frank Australia, one of the world’s leading
independent commercial and residential real estate consultancy firms. In Australia, Knight
Frank has over 1,000 employees across 24 offices.

Having grown up and educated in the United Kingdom, Stephen started his career in
Australia in 1982 with Jones Lang Wootton as an investment sales agent. In 1983, he joined Richard Ellis (which subsequently became CBRE), where he held various senior roles before being
promoted to Chief Executive Officer and President of the Australia and New Zealand business in 2002. Then in 2007, wishing to try something new, he left to start his own property development and investment company.

Stephen joined Knight Frank as Chief Executive Officer in October 2010, with a mandate to
rebuild the brand and re-establish its place as one of the top agencies in Australia.
Stephen believes that business is all about people, and by attracting the right
people and looking after them, you will deliver the best service and attract the best clients.

Since joining, Knight Frank has attracted over 650 new people and grown
significantly in both revenue and profitability. However, it is Knight Frank’s focus on being 'the place for the best property professionals' which sets it apart from the competitors.

Stephen has extensive experience in general consultancy work, investment advice, valuation and marketing activities. He is also past chairman of the Royal Institution of Chartered of Surveyors (Oceania).

description:
I apply three core values in everything I do – Honesty, Integrity and Professionalism.  I am hard working, passionate about great outcomes, and I thoroughly enjoy learning and development opportunities which enhance my own abilities, as well as helping to develop the careers of others and seeing them prosper.  

Over the past 21 years I have developed a strong multi-disciplinary skill set through various roles in the property industry, both in Australia and in Europe.  I have held a range of senior positions in global property agencies, across project management, occupier solutions and office leasing, as well as running Knight Frank’s multi-disciplinary North Shore business in Sydney.  Latterly, my business and leadership skills have been applied in developing and growing new business units, as well as re-building underperforming areas of the business to return them to profitability.  I am a Fellow of the RICS, and I speak at property industry events.

I joined Hub Australia to lead the property team in 2018.  In this role I am is responsible for sourcing and securing new properties for the business across Australia, negotiating legal agreements, managing the refurbishment and fitout of the spaces to create amazing environments for Hub members, and ongoing portfolio management. description:
With over 25 years of experience in the real estate industry, I specialise in providing high value market intelligence for the industrial sector.  My analysis reflects a deep understanding of the major players in the industrial real estate sector (listed property trusts, wholesale property trusts, syndicates and private developers).

As National Head of Industrial at Savills, I am responsible for our industrial real estate business operations and strategies across the country. I have successfully completed many major investment transactions, such as the sale of GIC's Australian logistics portfolio to Ascendas for AUD$1.037 billion,  BlackRock Property Trust’s industrial portfolio to the Goodman Australia Industrial Fund (GAIF) for AUD$115 million in 2012 and the sale of 218 Bannister Road, Canning Vale, WA from Australian Unity to Charter Hall for $125 million. 

Over the past two decades, I gained experience within industrial leasing and acquisitions while working for JLL, CBRE, Dexus and Savills.

During the course of my work, I have completed more high value industrial deals (over AUD$50 million) than any other agent in Australia.  I also achieved the largest industrial sale in Australia for a single asset, (AUD$301 million Defence National Distribution Centre sale), and was rewarded with the Goodman Best Capital Transaction award in 2007 and Dexus Transaction of the Year in 2012.

Specialties: • Industrial real estate 
• Industrial sales and leasing transactions 
• Property trusts
• Private developers
• Industrial development
• Industrial investment
• Foreign investment
• Tenant and buyer representation 
• Transaction management
• Site intelligence

My role on JLL's Global Industrial Board gives me access to global investors and corporate occupiers through JLL's global network of operators.

Since joining JLL I have negotiated in excess of $3 billion worth of deals. Some recent major investment transactions include: 
• The sale of the GIC  Australian Logistics Portfolio to Ascendas Real Estate Investment Trust (A-REIT) for AUD$1.073 billion
• The sale of the Coles CDC, Eastern Creek, NSW from GAIF/Brickworks to Mapletree Logistics Trust for AUD$253 million
• The sale of the Equity Commonwealth Portfolio to Propertylink for AUD$303 million
• The sale of the SRG Portfolio from WHSP to KWAP for AUD$153 million
• The sale of BlackRock Property Trust’s industrial portfolio to the Goodman Australia Industrial Fund (GAIF) for AUD$115 million. 
• The sale of the Colonial DPIF Portfolio assets for AUD$231 million.

Naturally intuitive with a gift for engaging people, a career in HR has offered me the opportunity to combine my knack for relationship building with strategic foresight and a practical business mind-set. 

Throughout an 18-year career providing HR leadership on a divisional and national level at Woolworths, recent experience leading a significant HR transformation for Valspar and a current focus on building a pioneering People & Culture strategy for retail disruptor, General Pants Co., I’ve built an eclectic and diverse skill set across operating models, professional verticals and in the delivery of challenging mandates. With experience across strategy, change, projects and executive business partnering, I know how to ‘make things happen’ – driving the identification and conversion of opportunities for improvement while carefully managing the risks inherent in any type of change or movement from the status quo.

I’m genuinely interested in people, their careers and their goals. Fascinated by psychology and its intersection with HR and workplace psychology, I know what makes people tick and what makes them recoil, how they will react to change and how to prepare them for it. Because of this, I’m known as an influencer and change agent, able to break the mould and think differently, while maintaining commercial focus and forward momentum.

Beyond this, I seek to empower emerging leaders across the business, building leadership capability and the knowledge of HR best practices to effectively manage commercial situations and improve performance. As a leader, I love to solve tricky situations through the creation of elegant solutions. Whether it be improving employee engagement or creating new strategies across talent, succession planning and recruitment, my ability to innovate and evaluate different perspectives is the key to my success in resolving scenarios that others may find insurmountable.
jobDescription:
Working with General Pants Co. at an incredibly exciting point in their growth story, my role is to develop and implement a transformative HR roadmap to embed company values across our people ecosystem, support rapid expansion and build a sustainable platform for high performance through best practice HR frameworks. 

General Pants Co. is a retail innovator that exists to disrupt the average and inspire young blooded individuals to create their own story. We search the globe to find new brands, products and experiences, incubating and editing them for our Australian customers. With over 55 stores in Australia, a record label and 2 stores in the US (LA and NYC), we are growing at a rapid rate. 

If you would like to join us on this journey, take a look here: https://www.generalpants.com.au/blog/join
jobDescription2: Reporting to the HR Director, I have been focused on supporting the business through a significant program of transformation. Leading a restructure of the HR team to align resources with the needs of a changing business, I’ve also been instrumental in leadership coaching, negotiating and streamlining national enterprise agreements, developing an integrated IR strategy and transforming HR from a transactional focus to a true business partner.

description:
Sue is a highly regarded, values-driven leader with more than 30 years experience in financial services across a range of customer segments and functions, and leading teams of up to 1,500 people.

Over the last 15 years she has led large operational and front line teams through significant transformational change, delivering improved outcomes for customers, employees and shareholders.

She has led teams across multiple locations in Australia, and developed high performing teams in New Zealand and the Philippines. 

Sue has significant experience in driving organizational change. She is an enterprise leader who uses her strong interpersonal skills to influence a wide range of stakeholders (internally and externally) and deliver the best outcome for the organization.

She has a collaborative style and brings multiple perspectives to the table in order to solve complex problems. She has a bias for action with emphasis on well managed, disciplined and focused execution.  

Sue is passionate about creating an environment that allows people to be the best they can be. This means creating a great experience for customers, and creating opportunities for staff to develop and progress. She is always looking at opportunities to improve and innovate, and she thrives on change and complexity. 

LEADERSHIP STYLE
-	Values-driven 
-	Strategic thinker
-	Results orientation
-	People leader
-	Influencer and collaborator
-	Customer focus

KNOWN AND RESPECTED FOR
-	Building diverse and high performing teams
-	Nurturing and developing talent  
-	Leading teams through transformational change
-	Disciplined execution and strong track record of delivery
-	Collaborative approach  and enterprise mindset

description:
Caroline Mills - Managing Director Allegra  Consulting Group, Chairman of Sisterworks Board

Caroline is an organisational change & transformation specialist with hands-on operational experience taking people on transformation journeys. She possesses both the high-level strategic skills to advise you on the approach, as well as the skills and the desire to help you create the engaged culture you want for lasting, successful change. Caroline has extensive experience as a senior leader in large corporates and really understands what its like to lead large teams and deliver results.

Caroline is a strong relationship builder – she is the stakeholder manager extraordinaire, a natural facilitator and mediator able to bring opposing views and teams together. In complex, large-scale transformations or cultural change programs, she is a very useful person to have work alongside you. 

Caroline’s clients include major financial institutions, government agencies, manufacturers; professional services companies, utilities and many others. Some of her clients include ANZ, NAB, ServiceNSW, Mercedes, Daimler, Urbis, Hume City Council, QBCC, Watercare Bupa.

Caroline has led large-scale transformation change and cultural programs across multiple geographies.

As part of Caroline’s values around giving back to the community on a “Not for Profit” basis she also works with several small businesses supporting through coaching and development programs.

Caroline’s qualifications include a Diploma in Business Management, Post Graduate Diploma in Human Resource Management, Bachelor of Arts in Education & Psychology, Diploma in Psychotherapy, Advanced Diploma in Metaphysics, Diploma in Energy Healing and she is an accredited Executive Coach and NLP Master Practitioner.

description:
Agile in approach and collaborative by nature, I bring a values-based style to HR leadership.  Always respectful of others, I am passionate about the work I do, committed to developing teams and organisational cultures that ensure the achievement of commercial objectives. 

A HR Executive with experience spanning workforce planning, change management,  regional HR management, leadership development, performance management, talent acquisition, employee engagement and industrial relations, I enjoy the challenges presented by complex working environments. Leveraging an early career foundation in commercial and operational leadership, I  partner with senior management and executive teams to deliver business outcomes. 

Advocating ‘seek first to understand’, I’m not afraid to ask the tough questions that elicit critical information with regards to business performance and organisational culture. Placing an emphasis on active listening, I’ve developed a reputation as a sounding board for a range of business matters, earning trust through non-judgemental, but strategically focused advice. It’s this balance of assertion and understanding that enables me to promote desired behaviours, protect individual wellbeing and execute people-centred resolutions that empower business transformation.

description:
Sharon is a Director for STARS Consulting International Pty Ltd.  The business specializes in the delivery and optimization of the Talent / Recruitment models and applications, develop innovative process design, solution optimization and can support small businesses and large global multi-national enterprises across the majority of industry sectors.  Its expertise is to support the end-to-end recruitment expertise, including the areas of Recruitment Strategy, Implementation, Operations, Supplier Management and Governance.

Sharon has wide leadership experience across all areas of Human Resources: Strategic workforce planning, Talent Management, Recruitment, Engagement, Change Management, Business Partnering, Merger & Acquisitions etc.

A strategic HR / Talent Aquisition professional with 20+ years of specific recruitment industry experience globally especially in the Asia Pacific, Australia and NZ markets.  An Experienced Program Manager and Offshoring Specialist in start up of off shore operations, a Change Agent with global experience across industries in the Financial Sector, Professional Services, Telecommunications and the Resources industry.

Sharon's experience includes design, build and leadership of resourcing functions globally, management of cross-border recruitment teams, trouble shooting and turnaround of failing recruitment functions, programme management and project management of value-add resourcing initiatives to enhance and optimise operational performance.  Wide experience also includes the Set Up, Operating Model and Managing Professional Shared Services hubs across HR, Finance and Marketing functions.

Sharon has spoken at several conferences around the world on change and sustainable transformation in Talent Management. She has strong cultural change, organisational development and leadership skills. 

Sharon has a strong interest in models to support sustainable transformation.

description:
15 years experience in Recruitment (in-house and agency).  Special interest/passion in
      
      improving the "candidate experience", job hunting techniques, resume writing etc...

Lisa Annese was appointed Chief Executive Officer for Diversity Council Australia (DCA) in June 2014.

Diversity Council Australia is the only independent, not-for-profit workplace diversity advisor to business in Australia. We offer a unique knowledge bank of research, practice and expertise across diversity dimensions developed in nearly 30 years of operation. 

Visit: http://dca.org.au/ for more information. 

Lisa has contributed widely to the public debate on issues relating to gender pay equity, paid parental leave, women in leadership, cultural diversity and workplace flexibility. Prior to her current appointment, Lisa was DCA's Programs & Member Services Director where she provided advice and education to DCA members to improve diversity management. 

Prior to joining DCA, Lisa worked as a Diversity Practitioner at Corrs Chambers Westgarth and before then, at the Workplace Gender Equality Agency where she developed the first ever census of ‘Australian Women in Leadership’, the first-ever ‘Business Achievement Awards’ and the creation of the ‘Employer of Choice for Women’ citation.

In 2004, Lisa co-authored “Chief Executives Unplugged: CEO’s Get Real About Women in the Workplace” which was named a “must-read business book” by AFR/BOSS magazine in 2005.

description:
Provide business solutions to businesses who need a boost and need to better understand why they are not achieving the goals (profits) they set. Having an impartial 3rd party come and review your operations, people, systems and processes and provide a sometimes uncomfortable assessment of how your business actually runs, is often all that is required to get your business back on track.

What is a Strategist?
A strategist looks at all inputs that will be important to a business and distills them into the right solution for future success. 

In my experience of taking over 'dysfunctional' teams, it is more often than not the systems and the processes that hinder the people to do their best work. 
__________________________________________________________________________________
jobDescription:
It is recognised that many businesses are based on solid fundamentals and have the potential to grow year on year, returning greater and greater profits for the owners and shareholder, yet very few do. There are often many reasons given for this, the economy, the market, competitors, poor weather etc. However most of the time there are more systemic issues predominantly around the people, systems and processes. At HR Lead Consulting we work through a process to uncover these systemic issues, provide tailored solutions and help you work through any problems to get you a better outcome, year on year. 
We are a HR System Specialist and can help you select the right HR Software for your business. We have the most detailed assessment on HR Software providers in the market. This enables companies to quickly and easily select the best vendor for their specific needs. Check out www.hrlead.com.au or Call to have a free consultation. +61 438 957 743.
jobDescription2:
Having seen both sides of many recruitment & labour hire businesses and being disappointed with their ‘bums on seat’ mentality, we went searching Australia for a recruitment company that cares about business outcomes. We found Red Appointments and liked them so much that we have partnered with them to bring them to Western Australia. This has enabled HR Lead Consulting to add a high quality service addition to our 'People' service stream offering.

Founded in 2009 by Simon Luhrs and Kerry Pimm, Red Appointments is a privately-owned recruitment company that provides a broad range of workforce recruitment services including permanent recruitment and labour hire.   Our clients include some of Australia’s most respected companies, representing a broad range of industry sectors from construction and industrial, to management and professional services.

We are different to other recruitment firms.  Our strengths lie in our ability to service a broad range of industries, our flexibility to meet tough briefs and our ability to offer a human-resource related advisory service to our clients.

We understand that very often, what our clients want is not an ‘off-the-shelf’ solution, but a well-considered, tailored approach to the provision of human resource.  They want a recruitment agency that can move as fast as they are moving and that can deliver on very specific briefs.

jobDescription2:
Press Release: Executive changes at Argus		
Date: 1/11/2013

eHealth pioneer Ross Davey today embarks on a new direction in the secure messaging industry as he steps down from the role of general manager at Argus to take on a part time role focusing on product direction and special projects.  Tania Oldaker, previously in charge of marketing for Argus, has taken on the role of general manager of the Argus business unit.

“Ross has made a substantial contribution to Argus and the messaging industry”, said Peter Young, managing director of DCA eHealth Solutions, now part of Telstra Health.  “He has taken the Argus business from an embryonic idea to become a major brand in eHealth. It is pleasing that Tania, who has gained extensive industry experience working for Ross over the past three years, is now in a position to take over the reins”.

jobDescription2:
RMIT is a leading global tertiary institution of technology, design and enterprise.  
It has revenue in excess of $1.2B, 83,000 students and over 11,000 staff.  It has four sites in Melbourne plus operations in Spain, Vietnam, Singapore, China, and staff operating in various locations across Europe.  It offers a range of education and research services.

Responsibilities
As Executive Director, HR I held full responsibility for the global people and culture agenda. This included end-to-end operational shared services as well as centres of excellence in Talent/OD, Business Partnering, Health Safety & Wellbeing, Employee Relations, Change and Workforce Planning.  

Achievements;
- Led significant organisational and structural change, transforming RMIT from a traditional academic institution into a customer oriented, commercial business.
- Improved staff engagement, stronger performance culture and reduced employee relations cases. Improved staff experience results from 67% to 75% 
- Successfully negotiated five enterprise agreements that improved business performance, reduced costs, provided more flexibility for our workforce and transformed the ER environment.
- Transformed Health & Safety performance: Achieved a significant reduction in both the WorkCover levy and Lost time injury frequency rate (LTIFR) 
- Championed Diversity & Inclusion. Achieved WGEA citation as Employer of Choice for the first time.  Significantly reduced gender pay gap and achieved improved gender targets.

description:
Recruiting in the banking and financial services sector for over 18 years in both Australia and the UK. Areas of specialisation include Investment and Retail Banking, Funds Management, Stockbroking, Custody, Insurance and Superannuation.  I have recruited senior/middle management levels on a contingency and retained basis.

I commenced my career with Reed Insurance and spent 7 years in the UK recruiting technical insurance professionals and then moved into banking recruitment within the London market for Badenoch and Clarke.

I made the move to Australia January 2007 to join Ambition Group and developed their Banking and Financial Services team in Melbourne until June 2012.

I moved into the internal world of Talent Acquisition as the TA Manager at ME Bank which sits within the wider People Experience team. This role encompasses the talent acquisition and talent management strategy, leading a team of 3 TA Specialists, as well as assisting the organisation with direct recruitment of senior roles nationally.

I am currently at National Australia Bank leading the Talent Acquisition team for the CP&S and Corporate Functions divisions which includes Digital, Marketing, Business/Consumer Lending, DT&S, Business Transformation, Product, Customer Journeys, People, Finance, Risk and Legal. (Approx 7000 FTE)

Specialties: Recruitment and Talent Management consulting across Retail & Investment Banking, Superannuation, Fund Management, Stockbroking, Custody and Insurance.

description:
Senior Human Resources professional with strong expertise, particularly in the areas of leadership, talent, performance, employee engagement and aspects of the employee lifecycle that reinforce a positive employee value proposition.  Demonstrated ability to move from strategy to execution in a timely and effective manner by building strong relationships through consultation and communication in a large and dynamic corporate environment.

Passion for working with people to enable them (and the organisation through its people) to be the best they can be.  Extensive experience dealing with people and issues at all levels of a large corporate organisation. Developed strategy and frameworks and supported the delivery of practical solutions that enhance the employee experience.

Demonstrated technical skills including: 

*  Change Management – specifically, managing the impact of change on people, incl. effective employee communications
*  Employee Engagement- including design, measurement and a focus on measureable improvement
*  Learning and Leadership–design and development, facilitation, building capability frameworks, assessment and managing development 
* Talent Management
*  Performance Management – process design, manager support including training, templates and materials
*  Organisational Design 
*  Strategic Business Partnering 
*  Coaching
*  Faciltiation - large and small group

Personal skills and attributes:

*  Excellent interpersonal and stakeholder management skills
*  Valued  thought leader, respected coach and mentor
*  Conceptual  thinker who can move easily to the pragmatic for execution
